descriptionParagraphs.name: Business need or problem
content:
McDonald’s managed scheduling field visits of various types on quarterly/annual basis to the restaurants manually. These visits are conducted by McDonald’s operations team to various franchisee restaurants for quality control purposes. Restaurants were spread across US and were divided across 10 field offices based in cities that serve as zone of operations. Each field office have approximately 1500 restaurants. In addition to that, each field office had a number of operations lead who have a set number of restaurants under them. They have subordinates to conducts the visits to each restaurants and the scheduling of these visits are done by the leads.

The manual scheduling process was carried over emails and other channels of communication which often led to conflicts. For example, say, there is a type of visit that has to happen quarterly for a restaurant. Since scheduling was done manually, it often led to scheduling the same type of visit to the same restaurant in same quarter. There are 10 types of visit that have different frequencies and have different business requirements.

descriptionParagraphs.name: Business solution
content:
This solution automates scheduling visits to restaurants by operations team. It is smart to consider various business logic and provide appropriate alerts, suggestions, alternatives (when possibly visit can be scheduled or when there is a conflict). The solution also considers existing database that contains historic data of all visits and incorporates in business logic.

The visit scheduling app is responsive and available across all mobile devices and modern desktop browsers.

The solution also provides a reporting app that shows visit status for all restaurant for field office.
